Text saved: Religion is very important to Pi, and although his family is Hindu, he is curious about other religions. Because of this, he makes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. To everyone's surprise, Pi says that he is a Hindu, a Muslim and a Christian all at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one religion, Pi refuses, explaining 'I just want to love God'. From that moment, his family and teachers decide to let him make his own mind up about religion.
